div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1454 Asia Minor, c. 1959 Burial: c. 125 B.C. ? (M) Contents: 119+ AR Athens: 102 New Style tetradr. Imit. Athens: 1 tetradr. (as Thompson 1374) Antiochus VII: 6 tetradr. ( Antiocheia 4, Tyre 1, Damascus 1) Alexander II: 10 tetradr. ( Antiocheia) Disposition: dispersed; photos in ANS The New Style tetradr. are dated 187/6 to 158/7 B.C. according to M. Thompson's chronology. As they are generally in better condition than the Seleucid coins, it seems possible that the two lots represent separate hds., combined in antiquity or in modern times
